conversation.text: Based on your preferences, I would recommend the movie "The Giver" by Philip K. Dick. The story is set in a future where violence and pain are completely eliminated. In this perfect world, people live in a giant community called "New York." The government controls everything, from people's thoughts to their actions. However, when one young boy named Jonas learns about the true nature of reality, he becomes disillusioned with his perfect life. He begins to question the government's authority and starts to explore alternative ways of living. Ultimately, Jonas realizes that there is more to life than just existence in a perfect world.

Based on your preferences, I recommend checking out "Sleepers" (1995) directed by Barry Levinson. The movie tells the story of a group of boys who are sent to a detention center where they are brutalized. Thirteen years later, an unexpected random encounter with a former guard gives them a chance for revenge.
Another recommendation could be "Lord of War" (2005) directed by Todd Phillips. The movie tells the story of an arms dealer confronts the morality of his work as he is being chased by an INTERPOL Agent.
For something more romantic, I would recommend checking out "You" (2014) directed by David Fincher. The movie tells the story of a young man named Jesse who lives in Los Angeles California U.S.A. He works part-time for a company called American Apparel and he does this work as part of his education in order to help him get into college later on.
Based on your preferences, I would recommend checking out "A Farewell to Arms" (1929) directed by Erich von Stolz. The movie tells the story of an English nurse and an American ambulance driver on the Italian front during World War 1 fall in love, but the horrors surrounding them challenge their romance to the limit.
Overall, based on your preferences, I would recommend checking out "Sleepers" (1995) directed by Barry Levinson.
